intro: Anemone coronaria proles cyanea, commonly known as the blue anemone, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple petals that surround a central cluster of yellow stamens. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces delicate, cup-shaped blooms in early spring. Its leaves are palmately divided and have a hairy texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. This species is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also found in wildflower meadows.
